title: Phase 1A-3: Create Pre-configured Browser Settings for Common Use Cases
objective: To provide developers with ready-to-use, opinionated browser configurations (`FAST_CONFIG`, `FULL_CONFIG`, `STEALTH_CONFIG`) to simplify common crawling tasks and reduce boilerplate code.
requirements: In `src/seo/browser_config.py`, three module-level constants MUST be defined as instances of `BrowserConfig`.

A `FAST_CONFIG` instance MUST be defined with `headless=True`, `capture_screenshots=False`, `capture_network=False`, and `block_resources` set to a list of common resource-heavy types (e.g., `["image", "stylesheet", "font", "media"]`).
A `FULL_CONFIG` instance MUST be defined with `headless=False`, `capture_screenshots=True`, and `capture_network=True` to facilitate debugging and comprehensive data capture.
A `STEALTH_CONFIG` instance MUST be defined with `stealth_mode=True` and `headless=True` to configure the browser for evasion of bot detection.
acceptance_criteria: The constants `FAST_CONFIG`, `FULL_CONFIG`, and `STEALTH_CONFIG` are importable from `src/seo/browser_config.py`.
The attributes of `FAST_CONFIG` reflect its purpose (e.g., `block_resources` is not empty).
The attributes of `FULL_CONFIG` reflect its purpose (e.g., `capture_screenshots` is True).
The attributes of `STEALTH_CONFIG` reflect its purpose (e.g., `stealth_mode` is True).

scenarios.name: Use the fast configuration
then: The `block_resources` attribute is a list containing strings like `"image"` and `"stylesheet"`.

requirements: There are no new security requirements introduced by this story. It builds upon the validated model from the previous story.

slos: There is no performance impact; these are constant, module-level object definitions.

deployment_steps: Modify `src/seo/browser_config.py` to add the new constant definitions.
